meanings.definition: To feed at the breast; suckle.
meanings.sent1: The baby will nursle for milk from its mother.
meanings.sent2: The newborn animals nursle eagerly from their mother's teats.
meanings.sent3: The little kitten tried to nursle from the dog, mistaking it for its mother.
meanings.sent4: The flower nursled the sunlight, growing stronger with each ray.
meanings.sent5: The hungry calf would always nursle with enthusiasm when it was feeding time.

meanings.sent1: She would always nursle her favorite teddy bear before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: The old lady would nursle the injured bird back to health with care.
meanings.sent3: He would nursle his lucky charm, believing it brought him good fortune.
meanings.sent4: The community would always nursle their traditions, passing them down through generations.
meanings.sent5: The gardener would always nursle the delicate flowers, ensuring they bloomed beautifully.
